messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Samurai Armour
messages.msgSnippet: Hello Mike Thanks for the heads up on the Tom Cruise Armour . I need to study more on this area. My size is 5 9 160 athletic build. I really appreciate the
messages.messageBody:
Hello Mike

Thanks for the heads up on the Tom Cruise Armour . I need to study more on this area. My size is 5' 9" 160 athletic build. I really appreciate the help. I'm just breaking into the study of the Samurai, ancient Japan, Armour, swords , the hole nine yards. I plan on purchasing a horse next spring and attempt to kit the horse out with reproduction custom made saddle and trimmings. So I have a lot of reading to do. First thing is Armour .

Takara

Michael Peters <shdwstel@...> wrote:
Takara,

Specifics make things much easier. :) That being said, how big are you?
Unless you are fairly small antiques won't fit. Nowadays, Japanese are about
the same height as your average American, but 150 or more years ago you're
looking at more like 4'11. Unfortunately the armour Tom wore was the worst
in the movie. The Dou was poorly shaped and fitted. The lacing was terrible.
What you PROBABLY want is a fair modern reproduction. If I remember
correctly a nuinobe dou with everything will run about $5000 from Kozando if
you are 5'6 to 5'11. Over 6' you're probably looking at custom. More
specifics will allow me to get you some more info.

MJPeters

>
>Thanks for the info. What I'm looking for is a set of Armour from the Edo
>Period or just before, that I can use during a living history display. It
>looks good, functions well and will not fall apart, will last for a long
>time to be passed on. What has cough my eye is the set that Tom Cruise wore
>during the movie The Last Samurai. Either Black or in Ox blood color. This
>Armour will be used on horse and in training. It needs to be good quality.
>
>Takara

_________________________________________________________________

Specifics make things much easier. :) That being said, how big are you?
Unless you are fairly small antiques won't fit. Nowadays, Japanese are about
the same height as your average American, but 150 or more years ago you're
looking at more like 4'11. Unfortunately the armour Tom wore was the worst

What you PROBABLY want is a fair modern reproduction. If I remember

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Samurai Armour
messages.msgSnippet: Mike and Paul Thanks for the info. What I m looking for is a set of Armour from the Edo Period or just before, that I can use during a living history display.
messages.messageBody:
Mike and Paul

Thanks for the info. What I'm looking for is a set of Armour from the Edo Period or just before, that I can use during a living history display. It looks good, functions well and will not fall apart, will last for a long time to be passed on. What has cough my eye is the set that Tom Cruise wore during the movie The Last Samurai. Either Black or in Ox blood color. This Armour will be used on horse and in training. It needs to be good quality.

Takara

Michael Peters <shdwstel@...> wrote:
Paul,
Matsushita-san (Kozando-sensei) is a friend of mine. While I would
classify his and Marutake-san's as the easiest choice, we really should find
out exactly what the person wants.

Takara,

What exactly do you want? Boy's day armour? Display sets? Museum quality
reproductions? Antiques? More specifics can get you better results.


MJPeters

"
>If you want good quality samurai armour thes eare the
>two places I recommend
>
>http://www.yoroi.co.jp/english/eindex.html
>
>http://www.kozando.co.jp/english/index_e.html
>
>It will cst you but these are the ones to get it from
>if you want the closest tot he rwal thing.
>
>other than that i suggest the paul chen armour
>
>
>Paul"


">Another question I have is where can I purchase a full
>set of Samurai
>Armour of good quality ?
>
>Takara"
>

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Samurai Armour
messages.msgSnippet: If you want good quality samurai armour thes eare the two places I recommend http://www.yoroi.co.jp/english/eindex.html
messages.messageBody:
If you want good quality samurai armour thes eare the
two places I recommend

http://www.yoroi.co.jp/english/eindex.html

http://www.kozando.co.jp/english/index_e.html

It will cst you but these are the ones to get it from
if you want the closest tot he rwal thing.

other than that i suggest the paul chen armour


Paul

Takara
